answers.answer: Hi.  I'm not a medical professional, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  Your child has many of the classic symptoms of diabetes, but may not have progressed far enough for the simple tests to catch it.  There is a test for pre-diabetes which looks for specific antibodies in the system, if you haven't requested that one yet, you should ask your doctor about it.

question: I have a 7 year old who has had high and low blood sugars with symptoms of both for a year.  We've seen three different doctors and had a lot of lab work done.  The lab fasting glucose was normal for the most part but at home he's gone up to 200 (not a lot of the time) and has dropped down to 50.  I can't seem to get any answers and the doctors have all told me it is not quite normal but that there is nothing wrong with that.  He has some blood work come back slightly high but not high enough to tell what's wrong with him or do anything about it. He urinates a lot, drinks a lot etc.  But will fluctuate depending on the day. Does anyone have any ideas about what else we can do??
title: Blood sugar fluctuation
